product_overview: AudioView is a mobile frontend application designed for streaming and managing movies and audio content, emphasizing accessible UX features, session persistence, responsive layouts, and performant media loading with robust error handling.
core_goals: Ensure seamless user authentication and session management with clear feedback and security.
Provide an intuitive and responsive home screen featuring categorized movie content with smooth scrolling and visual feedback.
Implement robust search and filter functionalities with real-time results and user-friendly empty states.
Support personalized user areas with protected access, displaying user data accurately.
Offer comprehensive settings with accessibility options to support visually impaired users.
Maintain consistent UI/UX across devices with responsive design and theme support including dark mode.
Handle network and API errors gracefully to ensure robustness in offline or error conditions.
key_features: Secure and user-friendly authentication flow supporting login, logout, and session persistence.
Responsive home screen with custom scroll views and categorized movie sections like 'New Releases', 'Popular Now', and 'Top 10'.
Horizontal scrollable category chips with visual selection cues.
Efficient image loading with caching and fallback visuals for movie posters.
Real-time search filtering with support for keyboard actions and empty state displays.
Tag and category filters to refine search results with accurate results.
Protected user profile and download sections prompting login when needed.
Accessibility features including toggles for audio description and closed captions, support for TalkBack and VoiceOver, semantic labeling of UI elements, and logical focus order.
Settings to manage network usage preferences and brightness with persistent state.
Consistent dark mode theme with good color contrast and text readability.
Error handling for network issues including offline mode and API timeout management.
user_flow_summary: User logs in with ID/PW, receives feedback on success or failure, and session persists across app restarts.
User navigates the home screen browsing categorized movie grids with smooth scrolling and responsive layout.
User conducts searches with instant filtering; when no results found, a clear 'No Results' screen is shown.
User interacts with filter tags to refine search results dynamically.
Non-authenticated users attempting to access protected sections are prompted to log in.
Users toggle accessibility features like audio description and subtitles in settings, with immediate effect.
Users adjust network and display settings, which persist between app uses.
Navigation across bottom tabs retains state; back button triggers exit confirmation modal.
App handles offline status and API timeouts by showing appropriate error screens and messages.
validation_criteria: Login succeeds with valid credentials and changes authentication state.
Error messages display correctly for invalid login attempts.
Session state is retained after app restart confirming persistent login.
Logout leads user to appropriate screen and protects zones requiring authentication.
Home screen layout is smooth, responsive, and sections have proper spacing.
Category chips provide visual feedback and allow horizontal scrolling without jank.
Movie poster images load quickly, cache effectively, and show placeholder on fail.
Search filters results in real-time; 'No Results' screen appears when applicable.
Filter tags update search input correctly and display accurate filtered results.
Access control prompts unauthenticated users to log in when accessing protected routes.
Accessibility toggles affect UI immediately; screen reader support is confirmed.
Settings changes save state persistently for network and display preferences.
Text elements handle overflow properly; dark theme colors provide sufficient contrast and readability.
Offline mode triggers appropriate UI warnings; API error timeouts handled gracefully.
